sentence: And House Minority Leader Kevin McCarthy and Judiciary Committee ranking member Jim Jordan (R-Ohio) have expressed objections to many of the antitrust proposals, casting doubts on the future of these efforts if the GOP takes over the House next year.
title: 2022 kicks off with tech nomination do-overs

sentence: “The only way to fix this is by encouraging competition and allowing it and promoting it, not eliminating it, and certainly not giving people a hall pass to engage in contact that would challenge, threaten, and undermine it.” Mr. Lee’s opposition to the legislation echoed complaints last year by Rep. Jim Jordan, Ohio Republican, against the House version of the bill.
author: Ryan Lovelace
title: Antitrust panel examines bill to give news publishers more negotiating power against Big Tech

sentence: Politico also acknowledges that Republican lawmakers have flocked to Breitbart to condemn the legislation: But the bill has also attracted major GOP critics such as Florida Sen. Marco Rubio, Tennessee Sen. Marsha Blackburn, House Minority Leader Kevin McCarthy and House Judiciary ranking member Jim Jordan of Ohio, all of whom have done interviews with Breitbart opposing the legislation.
author: Allum Bokhari
title: Politico Attacks Breitbart for Not Joining Media Cartel Bandwagon

sentence: Microsoft has been previously accused by its competitors, as well as lawmakers including Republican Ohio Rep. Jim Jordan, who chairs the House Judiciary Committee overseeing antitrust legislation, of influencing members of Congress to target Meta, Google, Apple and Amazon while exempting itself.
author: BPR Wire
title: Google accuses Microsoft of ‘carving out’ exception in anti-Big Tech bill targeting app stores
